attributes.action: Council Elections show loss of confidence in the Coalition call a General election now.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron, in the run up to the 2010 General Election, promised that he would introduce legislation, to allow By-elections to be called in Constituency's where the local Electorate lost trust and confidence in their constituency MP. In view of the massive loss of Conservative and Liberal Democrat seats in todays Council Elections, demonstrating a complete lack of trust in the Coalition Government, legislation should be introduced to call a General Election immediately.
